title: Thunderbird burning energy on Macbook M2
content:
Hello,

I have a MacBook Air M2, and I'm experiencing energy usage issues related to Thunderbird. This has kept happening for a long time now actually, surviving through at least two Mac OS updates, and a huge number of TB updates. Everything's up to date. I tried to follow this: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1269944 and this: https://wiki.mozilla.org/Thunderbird:Testing:Memory_Usage_Problems?_gl=1*86dj4d*_ga*MTkzNzQ0MjA3MS4xNzYyOTY4OTMx*_ga_2VC139B3XV*czE3NjMzMTM3NDckbzIkZzAkdDE3NjMzMTM3NDckajYwJGwwJGgw but didn't succeed. Actually, in my case, the issue is more noticeable: I normally have TB open in background - sometimes everything's fine, and the battery goes down as normal, while sometimes instead the battery drops quickly, and checking in the Mac activity monitor I can see that the CPU usage of TB is totally abnormal. When this happens, I can actually see the activity bar in TB being live (bottom right corner, as it happens when TB is checking for new mails), but never disappearing. When I notice it, I just reboot TB, and the bar shuts off as normal after a quick mail check. Moreover, checking the 24hr energy usage by app, TB is often on top with nonsense values.

I tried multiple times to rebuild the database, and do most of the tricks suggested, but didn't fix. Yes I have a huge mail archive, but the problem is not the standard management of this database: basically it seems that every now and then, TB decides to run some activity which it gets stuck in, and this kills the CPU.

Thank you in advance for your help!
creator: maXsc

title: Thunderbird hangs when trying to save a message

title: Rebuilding the Global Database does not complete
content: Search is not finding emails that I can see are there. I looked at "Rebuilding the Global Database does not complete (Mac)" and although I use Windows, I followed the hint to look at the Activity Manager and the Error Console after an attempt to re-index failed to complete. The Activity Manager showed "Indexing 429 of 5663 messages in Sent - horshamquakermeeting@phonecoop.coop (IMAP) (7% complete)" The Error Console showed "1764413544692 addons.xpi WARN Checking C:\Program Files (x86)\Mozilla Thunderbird\distribution\extensions for addons" I used Windows Explorer to look for addons.xpi on the whole of the C: drive. Not only is there not such a file but C:\Program Files (x86)\Mozilla Thunderbird\distribution does not have an extensions folder. Also I have previously looked in C:\Users\Michael\AppData\Roaming rather than C:\Program Files (x86) to find Thunderbird files. Thunderbird is otherwise behaving well, just that I can't search for emails. I may have deleted too many files earlier when I was trying to remove an addon that I didn't want. How do I get back to normal?

title: Pořadí účtů (složek)
content: Dobrý den. Doposud jsem používal starou verzi 102.15.1 (64 bitů). Mám 25 schránek - účtů. Pro jejich pořadí jsem používal doplněk Manually sort folders. Tento už není nějakou dobu podporován. Žádné aktuální rady jsem nenašel. Zkoušel jsem v pokročilém nastavení (mail.accountmanager.accounts) toto pořadí změnit a nastavit. Je tu ale položek více, ne účtů (zatím jsem přihlásil 3, ovšem v proměnné se jich nachází 5 (account4,account1,account3,account5,account2). Accont4 jsem přesunul na první pozici a současně nastavil hodnotu mail.accountmanager.defaultaccount na accont4. Nastavění se neprojevilo. Už si nevím rady s problémem, který je pro mne velmi zásadní. Proč Thunderbird něco nemá ve svém základu? Děkuji.
creator: bobobubo

title: Does Thunderbird support number of unread messages in taskbar icon in KDE in year 2025?
content:
Hi everyone,

I've moved from Windows 10 to Kubuntu 25.10 and recognized that there's no number of unread messages shown at the icon for Thunderbird in the taskbar. I've googled around and found suggestions of to install libindicator, extensions in Thunderbird, enable some settings etc. But the mentioned setting doesn't exist for me, the extension isn't available any more and installing libindicator didn't change anything. So, it looks to me like all of that info is simply outdated and some of it was from 10 years ago.

OTOH, what I can enable in Thunderbird is a notification whenever any new mail comes in. But that's not what I want. I would just like to see a counter at the top of the icon showing the unread messages. Individual new messages when arriving aren't of that much interest to me, I just want to know that there are some and I'm going to look at them at some point.

So, does Thunderbird support such counters for the KDE desktop environment? I simply don't think so.

Thanks!
creator: thorsten.schoening1

title: Thunderbird Suggestions
content:
Thunderbird 140.5.0esr (64-bit) on ubuntu unity 24.04 Desktop

Hi. I'm a long time and happy user of Thunderbird.

I have some suggestions to make it even better IMHO:

1. I would like to see some color added to the Calendar to make it visually more appealing. Right now it is grays and blacks - see attached pic. It would be nice if there were options to change the colors of the top 4 lines.

Currently you can choose a Category Color, but I would like to see the Title of the Event in that color, not just a tiny unobtrusive Bar at the end of the Title.

2. When you Click on an Event, a Screen comes up showing some information for that Event and an 'Edit' button. I don't see the point of this. Why not go directly into the Edit ? Of course for Multiple Occurrence Events, you would still first ask if the Edit is for 'Current' or 'All'.

3. I don't get the 'ESR' & 'Release' business. I have the 'ESR' version which, I believe, means I will only get updates once a year. Why ?

Seems like a hassle to convert to the 'Release' version. I don't think I will bother. Why not just have one version, and provide updates regularly as most other Software does?

I really appreciate this venue which provides the ability to post questions. Last week I got a long time problem resolved as a result.

Thanks for listening. M.....
creator: mjbox23
